instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the batteryâ€™s power rail connects to the motherboard. .
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liqued damage around battery connector
threads.message:
Hi..
old "pos" came in liqued damage around battery connector.
First replaced <CAPACITOR>C7035</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7036</CAPACITOR>.
then had short on battery connector line <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL>
after removing <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> and  <CAPACITOR>C6950</CAPACITOR> stil had short, after removing battery connector short gone (pin inside connector was bent and was making contact with the side of the connector ground)
replaced connector
0 volt on <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL>
replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR>, now get 12.43volt
but stil have X mark in the battery icon
checked <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> (both give 1.998 Kohm) (measured 1 other board it also gives me around the same 2.001kohm...) schematics says 1kohm tho.. schematic wrong?

<DIODE>D6950</DIODE> pin 2 i have 3.32 volt
<DIODE>D6950</DIODE> pin 1 0.039 fluktuating to 0.595volt (replaced <CAPACITOR>C6952</CAPACITOR> stil same result)
<DIODE>D6950</DIODE> changed to make sure same result


<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> replaced to make sure no change...

A: SMC
B: <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> again to make sure..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liqued damage around battery connector
threads.message: Keep praying, but you have a dead SMC. I assume you disconnected battery indicator.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liqued damage around battery connector
threads.message:
yes just lcd, battery and hdd

Damn SMC You know how mutch fun i have in that.... yes taking a correct one this time :)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liqued damage around battery connector
threads.message:
replaced SMC and ofcourse it works, charges fine now and also nice orange light

thanks again Duke

Mark as solved
